metadata.title: CVE-2019-18790 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in channels/chan_sip.c in Sangoma Asterisk 13.xbefore 13.29.2, 16.x before 16.6.2, and 17.x before 17.0.1, and CertifiedAsterisk 13.21 before cert5. A SIP request can be sent to Asterisk that canchange a SIP peer's IP address. A REGISTER does not need to occur, andcalls can be hijacked as a result. The only thing that needs to be known isthe peer's name; authentication details such as passwords do not need to beknown. This vulnerability is only exploitable when the nat option is set tothe default, or auto_force_rport.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18790` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-config - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mobile - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-modules - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mysql - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-tests - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:16.10.0~dfsg-1').
